column1: <title>Hap Hazard: a Manuscript Resource for Spenser Studies</title>

An archive comprising transcriptions of all the state documents written, copied, certified, addressed, or endorsed by Edmund Spenser in his capacity as secretary in the Elizabethan administration of Ireland, 1580-89.

A scholarly edition of Gonville & Caius College Cambridge MS 188/221, Edmund Spenser's A vewe of the present state of Ireland. Includes an introduction, textual notes, collaborative interpretive notes, and an archive of supplementary materials.

<td width=33% valign=top><font size=-1><center> A collection of diverse supplementary manuscript materials, including poetry and prose relating to Elizabethan Ireland and Edmund Spenser's political and literary context.</center></font>
